title: Ticket #7646: Update security docs for kerberos, krb5, afs, oauth, credmon, credd
description:
The security documentation needs an overhaul for configuring and using Kerberos and AFS, as well as OAuth tokens, the new usages of condor_store_cred, descriptions, locations, permissions of new directories, and more. Tons of old and irrelevant (and/or incorrect) stuff about the same topics should be removed.

Specifically for these tickets:

#7376 - Add support for Kerberos and AFS creds for running job

#7624 - clean up client to CredD interface for user impersonation

#7462 - Different token types should be distinguished in the cred dir

#7484 - oauth credentials are swept too quickly
remarks:
2020-Dec-29 11:40:08 by tannenba:
Why was this ticket resolved? A spot check of the documentation for AFS shows it is ancient and not updated.

This ticket has zero commits. Any ticket marked as resolved with zero commits needs a comment about why it is being resolved, as it is not apparent that any of the work specified in this ticket actually happened.

2020-Dec-29 12:31:32 by zmiller:
My guess is that tim saw that all the tickets mentioned in the description were resolved and then resolved this one. However, this is a documentation ticket, specifically for those code change tickets. I probably should have been marked it "docpending" immediately upon creation so it was more clear it was a doc ticket.
